Vex RAII Model - Resource Acquisition Is Initialization â€‹

Tarih: 12 AralÄ±k 2025
Durum: Tam UygulanmÄ±ÅŸ âœ…

ğŸ¯ Genel BakÄ±ÅŸ â€‹

Vex, RAII (Resource Acquisition Is Initialization) modelini Rust benzeri bir yaklaÅŸÄ±mla uygular ve Go'nun defer anahtar kelimesiyle birleÅŸtirir. Bu model, kaynak yÃ¶netiminin gÃ¼venli, Ã¶ngÃ¶rÃ¼lebilir ve otomatik olmasÄ±nÄ± saÄŸlar.

Temel Prensipler â€‹

  1. Otomatik Cleanup: Kaynaklar scope'tan Ã§Ä±karken otomatik olarak temizlenir
  2. Drop Trait: Drop contract'Ä±, destructor davranÄ±ÅŸÄ±nÄ± tanÄ±mlar
  3. Borrow Checker Entegrasyonu: Move analizi ile double-free korumasÄ±
  4. Defer DesteÄŸi: Go-style manuel cleanup sÄ±ralamasÄ±
  5. LIFO SÄ±ralama: Son oluÅŸturulan, ilk temizlenir (stack semantiÄŸi)

ğŸ“ Mimari â€‹

1. Drop Contract (Core) â€‹

vex
// std/contracts/src/memory.vx
export contract Drop {
    /// Otomatik olarak scope exit'te Ã§aÄŸrÄ±lÄ±r
    drop(self: &Self!);
}

Ã–zellikler:

  • DeÄŸiÅŸken scope'tan Ã§Ä±ktÄ±ÄŸÄ±nda otomatik Ã§aÄŸrÄ±lÄ±r
  • Mutable receiver (&Self!) - cleanup iÃ§in mutasyon gereklidir
  • Compiler tarafÄ±ndan implicit olarak enjekte edilir

2. Compiler Entegrasyonu â€‹

A. Drop Trait DesteÄŸi (drop_trait.rs) â€‹

Dosya: vex-compiler/src/codegen_ast/drop_trait.rs

Sorumluluklar:

  • Drop implementasyonlarÄ±nÄ± takip etme
  • Scope exit'te drop() Ã§aÄŸrÄ±larÄ± Ã¼retme
  • Move analizi entegrasyonu (double-free Ã¶nleme)
  • LIFO sÄ±ralama ile cleanup

API:

rust
// Move analizi set'leme (borrow checker'dan)
pub fn set_move_analysis(&mut self, analysis: MoveAnalysisResult)

// Function context'e giriÅŸ/Ã§Ä±kÄ±ÅŸ
pub(crate) fn enter_function_move_context(&mut self, func_name: &str)
pub(crate) fn exit_function_move_context(&mut self)

// Runtime'da move tracking
pub(crate) fn mark_variable_moved(&mut self, var_name: &str)
pub(crate) fn is_variable_moved(&self, var_name: &str) -> bool

// Scope bazlÄ± drop yÃ¶netimi
pub(crate) fn push_drop_scope(&mut self)
pub(crate) fn call_scope_drops(&mut self) -> Result<(), String>
pub(crate) fn pop_drop_scope(&mut self) -> Result<(), String>

B. Destructor Trait Support (destructors.rs) â€‹

Dosya: vex-compiler/src/codegen_ast/destructors.rs

Sorumluluklar:

  • Type bazlÄ± drop kontrol
  • Built-in type'larÄ±n (Vec, Box, String) drop'larÄ±
  • Struct drop method Ã§aÄŸrÄ±larÄ±
  • Runtime function declaration'larÄ±

API:

rust
// Drop variable kaydÄ±
pub(crate) fn register_drop_variable(&mut self, name: &str, value_type: &Type)

// Conditional drop
pub(crate) fn call_drop_if_needed(
    &mut self, 
    value: BasicValueEnum<'ctx>,
    value_type: &Type,
    var_name: &str
) -> Result<bool, String>

// Type checking
fn type_has_drop(&self, ty: &Type) -> bool

C. Scope Management (scope_management.rs) â€‹

Dosya: vex-compiler/src/codegen_ast/scope_management.rs

Sorumluluklar:

  • Legacy Destructor trait desteÄŸi (Vec, Box, Map, File, Channel)
  • Built-in type'larÄ±n cleanup'Ä±
  • Scope stack yÃ¶netimi

Built-in Destructors:

rust
// Vec, Box, String, Map, Set, Channel, File
self.destructor_impls.insert("Vec".to_string(), "vec_free".to_string());
self.destructor_impls.insert("Box".to_string(), "box_free".to_string());
self.destructor_impls.insert("Map".to_string(), "vex_map_free".to_string());
self.destructor_impls.insert("Channel".to_string(), "vex_channel_close".to_string());
self.destructor_impls.insert("File".to_string(), "vex_file_close".to_string());

3. Borrow Checker Entegrasyonu â€‹

Move Analysis â†’ Drop Prevention:

rust
// Borrow checker move analizi sonuÃ§larÄ± derleyiciye aktarÄ±lÄ±r
codegen.set_move_analysis(move_analysis_result);

// Function iÃ§inde move tracking
codegen.enter_function_move_context("my_function");

// Move olan deÄŸiÅŸkenler drop edilmez
if self.is_variable_moved(var_name) {
    continue; // Skip drop - double-free Ã¶nleme
}

Koruma MekanizmasÄ±:

  • Moved variable'lar drop scope'undan Ã§Ä±karÄ±lÄ±r
  • Ownership transfer durumunda cleanup yapÄ±lmaz
  • Compile-time + runtime move tracking

ğŸ”§ KullanÄ±m Ã–rnekleri â€‹

Ã–rnek 1: Otomatik Drop (Built-in Types) â€‹

vex
fn process_data() {
    let! file = File.open("data.txt")?;
    let! buffer = Vec.new<u8>();
    
    // KullanÄ±m...
    
}  // â† Otomatik cleanup LIFO:
   //   1. buffer'Ä±n drop()'u Ã§aÄŸrÄ±lÄ±r â†’ Vec cleanup
   //   2. file'Ä±n drop()'u Ã§aÄŸrÄ±lÄ±r â†’ File close

Compiler Output:

llvm
; Scope exit'te otomatik enjekte edilir:
call void @Vec_u8_drop(%Vec* %buffer)
call void @File_drop(%File* %file)

Ã–rnek 2: Custom Drop Implementation â€‹

vex
struct Database impl Drop {
    connection: *u8,
    is_open: bool,

    fn drop()! {
        if self.is_open {
            close_connection(self.connection);
            self.is_open = false;
        }
    }
}

fn query_db() {
    let! db = Database.connect("localhost:5432")?;
    
    // Query iÅŸlemleri...
    
}  // â† db.drop() otomatik Ã§aÄŸrÄ±lÄ±r

Ã–rnek 3: Defer (Manuel Cleanup SÄ±ralama) â€‹

vex
fn complex_operation() {
    let! lock = acquire_lock();
    defer lock.release();  // â† Son Ã§alÄ±ÅŸacak
    
    let! file = File.open("log.txt")?;
    defer file.close();    // â† Ä°lk Ã§alÄ±ÅŸacak
    
    // Ä°ÅŸlemler...
    
}  // â† Defer LIFO: file.close() â†’ lock.release()

Defer + Drop Birlikte:

  • Defer statements Ã¶nce execute edilir (LIFO)
  • Sonra otomatik drop'lar Ã§aÄŸrÄ±lÄ±r (LIFO)

Ã–rnek 4: Move Semantics + Drop â€‹

vex
fn transfer_ownership() {
    let! data = Vec.from([1, 2, 3]);
    
    consume(data);  // â† Ownership transfer (move)
    
}  // â† data'nÄ±n drop'u Ã§aÄŸrÄ±lmaz (moved)

fn consume(vec: Vec<i32>) {
    // vec burada kullanÄ±lÄ±r
}  // â† vec'in drop'u burada Ã§aÄŸrÄ±lÄ±r

Borrow Checker Analizi:

data â†’ moved to consume() at line X
Codegen: Skip drop for 'data' in transfer_ownership()
Codegen: Call drop for 'vec' in consume()

Ã–rnek 5: Early Return + Drop â€‹

vex
fn validate_and_process(value: i32): Result<i32, error> {
    defer log("Function exiting");
    
    let! temp = Vec.new<i32>();
    
    if value < 0 {
        return Err(error.new("Negative value"));
        // â† temp.drop() ve defer log() Ã§aÄŸrÄ±lÄ±r
    }
    
    temp.push(value);
    return Ok(value * 2);
    // â† temp.drop() ve defer log() Ã§aÄŸrÄ±lÄ±r
}

Garanti: TÃ¼m exit path'lerde cleanup Ã§alÄ±ÅŸÄ±r.

ğŸ—ï¸ Built-in Types ve Drop â€‹

Vec<T> â€‹

vex
// Runtime implementation
fn Vec_drop(self: &Vec<T>!) {
    if self.data != nil {
        vex_free(self.data);
        self.len = 0;
        self.cap = 0;
    }
}

Ã–zellikler:

  • Heap allocated data'yÄ± free eder
  • Generic type T iÃ§in Ã¶zelleÅŸtirilir
  • Nested drop'larÄ± handle eder

Box<T> â€‹

vex
fn Box_drop(self: &Box<T>!) {
    if self.ptr != nil {
        // T'nin drop'unu Ã§aÄŸÄ±r (eÄŸer varsa)
        if T implements Drop {
            T.drop(self.ptr);
        }
        vex_free(self.ptr);
        self.ptr = nil;
    }
}

String â€‹

vex
fn vex_string_drop(self: &vex_smart_string_t!) {
    if self.is_heap {
        vex_free(self.heap_data.ptr);
    }
}

Smart String: SSO (Small String Optimization) kullanÄ±r.

Rc<T> (Reference Counted) â€‹

vex
// std/sync/src/rc.vx
export struct Rc<T> impl Drop {
    _ptr: *u8
}

fn (self: &Rc<T>) drop() {
    vex_rc_drop(self._ptr);  // Ref count decrement + conditional free
}

Ã–zellikler:

  • Reference counting (single-threaded)
  • Strong count == 0 â†’ data free
  • Weak count == 0 â†’ metadata free

Arc<T> (Atomic Reference Counted) â€‹

vex
// Future: Thread-safe reference counting
struct Arc<T> impl Drop {
    fn drop()! {
        atomic_dec(self.strong_count);
        if self.strong_count == 0 {
            // Free data + metadata
        }
    }
}

ğŸ” Implementation Details â€‹

Drop Scope Stack â€‹

rust
// Compiler internal state
pub struct ASTCodeGen<'ctx> {
    scope_stack: Vec<Vec<(String, String)>>,  // [(var_name, type_name)]
    move_analysis: Option<MoveAnalysisResult>,
    current_function_moved_vars: HashSet<String>,
    // ...
}

Scope Stack Ä°ÅŸleyiÅŸi:

  1. Function/block entry â†’ push_drop_scope()
  2. Variable declaration â†’ register_drop_variable(name, type)
  3. Scope exit â†’ call_scope_drops() (LIFO)
  4. Scope pop â†’ pop_drop_scope()

LLVM Codegen Pattern â€‹

Vex Source:

vex
fn example() {
    let! vec = Vec.from([1, 2, 3]);
    let! box = Box.new(42);
}

Generated LLVM IR:

llvm
define void @example() {
entry:
  %vec = alloca %Vec
  %box = alloca %Box
  
  ; ... initialization ...
  
  ; Scope exit cleanup (reverse order):
cleanup:
  ; box.drop()
  call void @Box_i32_drop(%Box* %box)
  
  ; vec.drop()
  call void @Vec_i32_drop(%Vec* %vec)
  
  ret void
}

Drop Method Naming Convention â€‹

rust
// Type name â†’ Drop method name
Vec<i32>     â†’ Vec_i32_drop
Box<string>  â†’ Box_string_drop
File         â†’ File_drop
Database     â†’ Database_drop

Generic Instantiation:

rust
// Vec<T> iÃ§in drop instantiation
let mangled_name = format!("{}_{}_drop", base_struct, type_arg);
if let Ok(drop_fn_def) = self.find_generic_method(base_struct, "drop") {
    self.instantiate_generic_method(base_struct, &type_args, "drop", &drop_fn_def, &[])
}

âš¡ Performance Characteristics â€‹

Zero-Cost Abstraction â€‹

Vex Drop:

vex
{
    let! file = File.open("data.txt")?;
}

Manual C Equivalent:

c
{
    FILE* file = fopen("data.txt", "r");
    fclose(file);  // ProgramcÄ± unutursa â†’ memory leak
}

Cost: AynÄ± assembly code, ancak gÃ¼venlik garantili.

Compile-Time Optimization â€‹

  1. Statik dispatch: Drop method Ã§aÄŸrÄ±larÄ± inline edilebilir
  2. Dead code elimination: Unused variable'lar drop code'suz optimize edilir
  3. Move elision: Unnecessary drop'lar eliminates edilir

Runtime Overhead â€‹

  • SÄ±fÄ±r runtime cost (LLVM optimization'dan sonra)
  • Stack-based cleanup: Function epilogue'da execute edilir
  • No hidden allocations: Drop'lar ek heap allocation yapmaz

ğŸ” GÃ¼venlik Garantileri â€‹

1. Double-Free KorumasÄ± â€‹

vex
fn transfer() {
    let! vec = Vec.from([1, 2, 3]);
    consume(vec);  // â† Move
}  // âœ… vec'in drop'u Ã§aÄŸrÄ±lmaz (move tracking)

Mekanizma:

  • Borrow checker move analysis
  • Codegen'de is_variable_moved() kontrolÃ¼
  • Compiler error on use-after-move

2. Leak KorumasÄ± â€‹

vex
fn example() {
    let! file = File.open("data.txt")?;
    
    if error_condition() {
        return;  // âœ… file.drop() yine de Ã§aÄŸrÄ±lÄ±r
    }
    
    panic("Critical error");  // âœ… file.drop() Ã§aÄŸrÄ±lÄ±r
}

Garanti: TÃ¼m exit path'lerde cleanup.

3. Exception Safety (Future) â€‹

vex
fn risky_operation() {
    let! lock = Mutex.lock();
    defer lock.unlock();
    
    // Panic durumunda bile unlock garantili
    dangerous_code()?;
}

ğŸ­ Defer Statement â€‹

Syntax â€‹

vex
defer expression;  // Function call veya statement

Execution Semantics â€‹

LIFO (Stack) Order:

vex
fn demo() {
    defer print("1");
    defer print("2");
    defer print("3");
}  // Output: 3, 2, 1

Defer + Drop Interaction â€‹

vex
fn combined() {
    let! vec = Vec.new<i32>();
    defer print("Defer 1");
    
    let! box = Box.new(42);
    defer print("Defer 2");
}
// Execution order:
// 1. print("Defer 2")  â† Defer LIFO
// 2. print("Defer 1")  
// 3. box.drop()        â† Drop LIFO
// 4. vec.drop()

Rule: Defer statements execute BEFORE automatic drops.

Implementation â€‹

AST Node:

rust
pub enum Statement {
    Defer {
        expr: Box<Expression>,
        span_id: Option<String>,
    },
    // ...
}

Codegen:

rust
// Defer stack per function
fn compile_statement(&mut self, stmt: &Statement) -> Result<(), String> {
    match stmt {
        Statement::Defer { expr, .. } => {
            self.defer_stack.push(expr.clone());
            Ok(())
        }
        Statement::Return { .. } => {
            self.execute_defers()?;  // Emit defer code
            // ... return code ...
        }
    }
}

ğŸ“š Stdlib Ã–rnekleri â€‹

File (I/O Resource) â€‹

vex
// vex-libs/std/io/src/file.vx
struct File impl Drop {
    handle: *u8,
    path: string,

    fn drop()! {
        if self.handle != nil {
            vex_file_close(self.handle);
            self.handle = nil;
        }
    }
}

Mutex (Sync Primitive) â€‹

vex
// vex-libs/std/sync/src/mutex.vx
export struct Mutex<T> impl Drop {
    _ptr: *u8
}

fn (self: &Mutex<T>) drop() {
    vex_mutex_drop(self._ptr);  // Native cleanup
}

AtomicI32 (Atomic Type) â€‹

vex
// vex-libs/std/sync/src/atomic.vx
export struct AtomicI32 impl Drop {
    _ptr: *u8
}

fn (self: &AtomicI32) drop() {
    vex_atomic_i32_drop(self._ptr);
}

RwLock (Reader-Writer Lock) â€‹

vex
// vex-libs/std/sync/src/rwLock.vx
export struct RwLock<T> impl Drop {
    _ptr: *u8
}

// Guard structs also implement Drop
export struct RwLockReadGuard<T> impl Drop {
    // Auto-unlock on scope exit
}

export struct RwLockWriteGuard<T> impl Drop {
    // Auto-unlock on scope exit
}

ğŸ§ª Test Coverage â€‹

Test Files â€‹

  1. examples/defer_simple.vx - LIFO defer order
  2. examples/defer_early_return.vx - Multiple exit paths
  3. examples/defer_test.vx - Complex defer scenarios

Drop Test Scenarios â€‹

bash
# Built-in types
~/.cargo/target/debug/vex run examples/test_vec_drop.vx
~/.cargo/target/debug/vex run examples/test_box_drop.vx
~/.cargo/target/debug/vex run examples/test_string_drop.vx

# Custom structs
~/.cargo/target/debug/vex run examples/test_custom_drop.vx

# Move semantics
~/.cargo/target/debug/vex run examples/test_move_no_drop.vx

Expected Behavior â€‹

vex
fn test_lifo_order() {
    defer print("3");
    let! a = Resource.new("A");
    defer print("2");
    let! b = Resource.new("B");
    defer print("1");
}
// Output:
// 1
// 2
// B.drop()
// A.drop()
// 3

ğŸš€ Future Enhancements â€‹

1. Async Drop (Future) â€‹

vex
contract AsyncDrop {
    async fn drop()!;
}

struct AsyncFile impl AsyncDrop {
    async fn drop()! {
        await self.flush();
        await self.close();
    }
}

2. Conditional Drop â€‹

vex
struct OptionalCleanup<T> impl Drop {
    data: T,
    should_cleanup: bool,

    fn drop()! {
        if self.should_cleanup {
            cleanup(self.data);
        }
    }
}

3. Drop Order Control â€‹

vex
#[drop_order(1)]
struct FirstDrop { ... }

#[drop_order(2)]
struct SecondDrop { ... }

4. Drop Guards (Panic Safety) â€‹

vex
struct DropGuard<F: FnOnce()> {
    f: Option<F>,

    fn drop()! {
        if let Some(f) = self.f {
            f();  // Guaranteed execution
        }
    }
}

ğŸ“– Comparison with Other Languages â€‹

Rust â€‹

Similarities:

  • Drop trait (Vex: Drop contract)
  • Automatic drop on scope exit
  • Move semantics integration

Differences:

  • Vex: defer support (Rust: manual RAII guards)
  • Vex: let! mutability (Rust: mut)
  • Vex: . operator (Rust: :: for paths)

C++ â€‹

Similarities:

  • RAII pattern (constructor/destructor)
  • Stack unwinding cleanup

Differences:

  • Vex: No manual destructors (contract-based)
  • Vex: No exceptions (Result<T, E>)
  • Vex: Borrow checker prevents UAF

Go â€‹

Similarities:

  • defer statement
  • Automatic cleanup

Differences:

  • Vex: Type-based drop (Go: manual defer only)
  • Vex: Compile-time safety (Go: runtime GC)
  • Vex: LIFO drop order guaranteed

ğŸ¯ Best Practices â€‹

1. Implement Drop for Resources â€‹

vex
struct Database impl Drop {
    connection: *u8,

    fn drop()! {
        if self.connection != nil {
            close_connection(self.connection);
        }
    }
}

Rule: TÃ¼m resource-owning type'lar Drop implement etmeli.

2. Use Defer for Ordering â€‹

vex
fn transaction() {
    let! tx = begin_transaction();
    defer tx.commit();  // Last action
    
    // Operations...
}

Rule: Cleanup sÄ±rasÄ±nÄ±n Ã¶nemli olduÄŸu durumlarda defer kullan.

3. Avoid Drop in Drop â€‹

vex
struct Wrapper impl Drop {
    inner: Vec<i32>,  // âœ… Inner type has drop

    fn drop()! {
        // âŒ DON'T: self.inner.drop() - otomatik Ã§aÄŸrÄ±lÄ±r
        // âœ… DO: Ek cleanup logic ekle
        log("Wrapper dropped");
    }
}

Rule: Nested type'larÄ±n drop'u otomatik Ã§aÄŸrÄ±lÄ±r.

4. Test Drop Logic â€‹

vex
#[test]
fn test_cleanup() {
    let! resource = Resource.new();
    // Use resource
    resource.check_state();
}  // Drop happens here - add assertions

ğŸ› Common Pitfalls â€‹

1. Forgetting Move Semantics â€‹

vex
fn wrong() {
    let! vec = Vec.from([1, 2, 3]);
    consume(vec);
    println(vec.len);  // âŒ Compile error: use after move
}

Solution: Borrow checker otomatik catch eder.

2. Drop Order Assumptions â€‹

vex
struct A impl Drop { ... }
struct B impl Drop { ... }

fn unordered() {
    let! a = A.new();
    let! b = B.new();
}  // âš ï¸ Order: b.drop() â†’ a.drop() (LIFO)

Solution: Defer kullanarak explicit order belirle.

3. Circular References (Future) â€‹

vex
struct Node impl Drop {
    next: Option<Box<Node>>,  // âš ï¸ Potential stack overflow
}

Solution: Weak<T> references kullan (future).
